intro: Erigeron uncialis subsp. typicus, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The subspecies typicus is distinguished by its specific floral and morphological traits compared to other subspecies of Erigeron uncialis.
